abstract: New York Gov Andrew M Cuomo is weighing whether to sign a bill on special education that opponents argue would give families more power to send their children to religious schools at taxpayers’ expense; measure, passed by both houses of the State Legislature, stipulates that home life and family background of special education students must be taken into consideration when public school officials decide whether to place a child in a public school or pay for private schooling.
lead_paragraph: Opponents argue that the measure, passed by both houses of the State Legislature, would give families more power to send their children to religious schools at taxpayers’ expense.
